csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Parabolic SAR (Stop and Reverse)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// Trend-following indicator that sets trailing stops.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>SAR(t) = SAR(t-1) + AF * (EP - SAR(t-1))</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>AF: Acceleration Factor (starts at 0.02, increases by 0.02 each new extreme).</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>EP: Extreme Point (highest High in uptrend, lowest Low in downtrend).</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class ParabolicSAR
18 {
19 public decimal AccelerationFactor { get; }
20 public decimal MaxAcceleration { get; }
21 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
22​
23 public ParabolicSAR(decimal accelerationFactor = 0.02m, decimal maxAcceleration = 0.2m)
24 {
25 AccelerationFactor = accelerationFactor;
26 MaxAcceleration = maxAcceleration;
27 }
28​
29 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
30 {
31 Values.Clear();
32 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
33​
34 if (candleList.Count < 2)
35 {
36 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++) Values.Add(null);
37 return;
38 }
39​
40 // Step 1: Initial Trend Determination
41 bool isUptrend = candleList[1].Close > candleList[0].Close;
42 decimal sar = isUptrend ? candleList[0].Low : candleList[0].High;
43 decimal ep = isUptrend ? candleList[0].High : candleList[0].Low;
44 decimal af = AccelerationFactor;
45​
46 Values.Add(null); // No SAR for first candle
47​
48 // Step 2: Iterate
49 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
50 {
51 var candle = candleList[i];
52​
53 if (isUptrend)
54 {
55 // Switch to Downtrend?
56 if (candle.Low < sar)
57 {
58 isUptrend = false;
59 sar = ep; // SAR flips to the Extreme Point
60 ep = candle.Low;
61 af = AccelerationFactor; // Reset AF
62 }
63 else
64 {
65 // Update Uptrend
66 if (candle.High > ep)
67 {
68 ep = candle.High;
69 af = Math.Min(af + AccelerationFactor, MaxAcceleration);
70 }
71 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar);
72 // Prevent SAR from exceeding previous lows (Protection)
73 sar = Math.Min(sar, Math.Min(candleList[i - 1].Low, i > 1 ? candleList[i - 2].Low : candleList[i - 1].Low));
74 }
75 }
76 else
77 {
78 // Switch to Uptrend?
79 if (candle.High > sar)
80 {
81 isUptrend = true;
82 sar = ep;
83 ep = candle.High;
84 af = AccelerationFactor;
85 }
86 else
87 {
88 // Update Downtrend
89 if (candle.Low < ep)
90 {
91 ep = candle.Low;
92 af = Math.Min(af + AccelerationFactor, MaxAcceleration);
93 }
94 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar);
95 // Prevent SAR from exceeding previous highs (Protection)
96 sar = Math.Max(sar, Math.Max(candleList[i - 1].High, i > 1 ? candleList[i - 2].High : candleList[i - 1].High));
97 }
98 }
99​
100 Values.Add(sar);
101 }
102 }
103​
104 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, decimal af = 0.02m, decimal maxAf = 0.2m)
105 {
106 var psar = new ParabolicSAR(af, maxAf);
107 psar.Calculate(candles);
108 return psar.Values;
109 }
110 }
111}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// Logic Breakdown (ParabolicSAR)
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6// Parabolic SAR (Stop and Reverse) technical indicator.
7// We explain *why* code is written this way and *how* data transforms
8// line-by-line, targeting programming beginners.
9//
10// [Core Concepts]
11//
12// 1. What is Parabolic SAR?
13// [Creator] J. Welles Wilder Jr. (1978)
14// [Full Name] Parabolic Stop And Reverse
15// [Purpose] Trend-following indicator that provides:
16// - Entry/Exit signals (when dots flip)
17// - Trailing stop levels (the dots themselves)
18//
19// 2. Key Components
20//
21// | Component | Meaning |
22// |-----------|-----------------------------------------------|
23// | SAR | Current Stop And Reverse level (the dot) |
24// | EP | Extreme Point (highest high or lowest low) |
25// | AF | Acceleration Factor (starts at 0.02) |
26//
27// 3. Visual Representation
28//
29// Uptrend (SAR below price): Downtrend (SAR above price):
30//
31// ●────● ────────────
32// / \ ●
33// ● ● / \
34// / ● ●
35// ● /
36// / ●
37// ●
38// (trailing stop rises) (trailing stop falls)
39//
40// 4. How SAR "Accelerates"
41// [Why] As trend continues, SAR gets closer to price (trailing stop tightens).
42// [How] Each new EP increases AF by 0.02, up to maximum 0.20.
43//
44// 5. Signal Interpretation
45//
46// | Position of SAR | Trend | Action |
47// |-----------------|-----------|---------------|
48// | Below price | Uptrend | Long position |
49// | Above price | Downtrend | Short/Exit |
50// | Flips position | Reversal | Stop & Reverse|
51//
52// =============================================================================
53​
54using System;
55using System.Collections.Generic;
56​
57namespace TechnicalIndicators
58{
59 // =============================================================================
60 // Logic Explanation: OHLCV Data Container
61 // =============================================================================
62 public readonly record struct CandleData(
63 DateTime Timestamp,
64 decimal Open,
65 decimal High,
66 decimal Low,
67 decimal Close,
68 long Volume
69 );
70​
71 // =============================================================================
72 // Logic Explanation: ParabolicSAR Class
73 // =============================================================================
74 public class ParabolicSAR
75 {
76 // -------------------------------------------------------------
77 // Logic Explanation: Configuration
78 //
79 // [AccelerationFactor] Initial and increment value for AF.
80 // [MaxAcceleration] Cap for AF (prevents SAR from moving too fast).
81 // -------------------------------------------------------------
82 public decimal AccelerationFactor { get; }
83 public decimal MaxAcceleration { get; }
84 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
85​
86 // =============================================================================
87 // Logic Explanation: Constructor
88 // =============================================================================
89 public ParabolicSAR(decimal accelerationFactor = 0.02m, decimal maxAcceleration = 0.2m)
90 {
91 AccelerationFactor = accelerationFactor;
92 MaxAcceleration = maxAcceleration;
93 }
94​
95 // =============================================================================
96 // Logic Explanation: Main Calculation Method
97 // =============================================================================
98 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
99 {
100 // -------------------------------------------------------------
101 // Step 1: Cleanup & Setup
102 // -------------------------------------------------------------
103 Values.Clear();
104 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
105​
106 // Need at least 2 candles for initial trend determination
107 if (candleList.Count < 2)
108 {
109 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
110 Values.Add(null);
111 return;
112 }
113​
114 // -------------------------------------------------------------
115 // Step 2: Initialize Trend, SAR, EP, AF
116 //
117 // [Trend Detection] Compare Close[1] vs Close[0]
118 // [SAR Initial]
119 // Uptrend: SAR = Low[0] (start below price)
120 // Downtrend: SAR = High[0] (start above price)
121 // [EP Initial]
122 // Uptrend: EP = High[0] (track highest high)
123 // Downtrend: EP = Low[0] (track lowest low)
124 // -------------------------------------------------------------
125 bool isUptrend = candleList[1].Close > candleList[0].Close;
126 decimal sar = isUptrend ? candleList[0].Low : candleList[0].High;
127 decimal ep = isUptrend ? candleList[0].High : candleList[0].Low;
128 decimal af = AccelerationFactor;
129​
130 // First candle has no SAR
131 Values.Add(null);
132​
133 // -------------------------------------------------------------
134 // Step 3: Main Loop
135 // -------------------------------------------------------------
136 for (int i = 1; i < candleList.Count; i++)
137 {
138 var candle = candleList[i];
139​
140 // -------------------------------------------------------------
141 // Step 4A: Uptrend Logic
142 // -------------------------------------------------------------
143 if (isUptrend)
144 {
145 // [Reversal Check] Price breaks below SAR
146 if (candle.Low < sar)
147 {
148 // FLIP to downtrend
149 isUptrend = false;
150 sar = ep; // SAR becomes previous extreme
151 ep = candle.Low; // New EP is current low
152 af = AccelerationFactor; // Reset AF
153 }
154 else
155 {
156 // [Continuation] Update EP and AF if new high
157 if (candle.High > ep)
158 {
159 ep = candle.High;
160 af = Math.Min(af + AccelerationFactor, MaxAcceleration);
161 }
162​
163 // [Update SAR] Move towards EP
164 // SAR = SAR + AF × (EP - SAR)
165 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar);
166​
167 // [Safety Clamp] SAR cannot be above last 2 lows
168 sar = Math.Min(sar, Math.Min(candleList[i - 1].Low,
169 i > 1 ? candleList[i - 2].Low : candleList[i - 1].Low));
170 }
171 }
172 // -------------------------------------------------------------
173 // Step 4B: Downtrend Logic
174 // -------------------------------------------------------------
175 else
176 {
177 // [Reversal Check] Price breaks above SAR
178 if (candle.High > sar)
179 {
180 // FLIP to uptrend
181 isUptrend = true;
182 sar = ep; // SAR becomes previous extreme
183 ep = candle.High; // New EP is current high
184 af = AccelerationFactor; // Reset AF
185 }
186 else
187 {
188 // [Continuation] Update EP and AF if new low
189 if (candle.Low < ep)
190 {
191 ep = candle.Low;
192 af = Math.Min(af + AccelerationFactor, MaxAcceleration);
193 }
194​
195 // [Update SAR] Move towards EP
196 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar);
197​
198 // [Safety Clamp] SAR cannot be below last 2 highs
199 sar = Math.Max(sar, Math.Max(candleList[i - 1].High,
200 i > 1 ? candleList[i - 2].High : candleList[i - 1].High));
201 }
202 }
203​
204 Values.Add(sar);
205 }
206 }
207​
208 // =============================================================================
209 // Logic Explanation: Static Convenience Wrapper
210 //
211 // [IPO Block]
212 // Input: IEnumerable<CandleData>, af, maxAf
213 // Process: Creates instance, runs Calculate()
214 // Output: List of SAR values (trailing stop levels)
215 // =============================================================================
216 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles, decimal af = 0.02m, decimal maxAf = 0.2m)
217 {
218 var psar = new ParabolicSAR(af, maxAf);
219 psar.Calculate(candles);
220 return psar.Values;
221 }
222 }
223}
python_simple:
1class ParabolicSAR:
2 """
3 Parabolic SAR
4 """
5 def __init__(self, af=0.02, max_af=0.2):
6 self.af_start = af
7 self.max_af = max_af
8 self.values = []
9​
10 def calculate(self, candles):
11 self.values.clear()
12 if len(candles) < 2:
13 self.values = [None] * len(candles)
14 return
15​
16 is_uptrend = float(candles[1]['close']) > float(candles[0]['close'])
17 sar = float(candles[0]['low']) if is_uptrend else float(candles[0]['high'])
18 ep = float(candles[0]['high']) if is_uptrend else float(candles[0]['low'])
19 af = self.af_start
20​
21 self.values.append(None) # Index 0
22​
23 for i in range(1, len(candles)):
24 high = float(candles[i]['high'])
25 low = float(candles[i]['low'])
26
27 # Logic happens *before* calculating SAR for *tomorrow*, but here we output SAR for *today*.
28 # The standard logic finds the SAR for 'today' based on 'yesterday's' data.
29 # But inside the loop, we check flip conditions based on current candle limits.
30
31 if is_uptrend:
32 if low < sar:
33 is_uptrend = False
34 sar = ep
35 ep = low
36 af = self.af_start
37 else:
38 if high > ep:
39 ep = high
40 af = min(af + self.af_start, self.max_af)
41
42 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar)
43
44 prev_low1 = float(candles[i-1]['low'])
45 prev_low2 = float(candles[i-2]['low']) if i > 1 else prev_low1
46 sar = min(sar, prev_low1, prev_low2)
47 else:
48 if high > sar:
49 is_uptrend = True
50 sar = ep
51 ep = high
52 af = self.af_start
53 else:
54 if low < ep:
55 ep = low
56 af = min(af + self.af_start, self.max_af)
57
58 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar)
59
60 prev_high1 = float(candles[i-1]['high'])
61 prev_high2 = float(candles[i-2]['high']) if i > 1 else prev_high1
62 sar = max(sar, prev_high1, prev_high2)
63
64 self.values.append(sar)
65​
66def calculate(candles, af=0.02, max_af=0.2):
67 psar = ParabolicSAR(af, max_af)
68 psar.calculate(candles)
69 return psar.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Parabolic SAR)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Parabolic SAR (Stop and Reverse). We explain *why* code is written
7# this way and *how* data transforms line-by-line.
8#
9# [Core Concepts]
10# 1. State Machine
11# - The SAR is a system that can be in one of two states: UPTREND or DOWNTREND.
12# - It flips state ONLY when price crosses the SAR line.
13#
14# 2. Acceleration Factor (AF)
15# - The SAR moves parabolic-ally because of the AF.
16# - Starts at 0.02.
17# - Increases by 0.02 every time a New High (in Uptrend) or New Low (in Downtrend) is made.
18# - This tightens the stop as the trend matures, protecting profits.
19#
20# 3. The "Extreme Point" (EP)
21# - Tracks the highest high (Uptrend) or lowest low (Downtrend) reached so far.
22# - When trend reverses, the SAR jumps to the old EP.
23#
24# =============================================================================
25​
26# -------------------------------------------------------------
27# Type-Level Explanation: ParabolicSAR (class)
28#
29# [Why] Maintains complex state (Trend, AF, EP, SAR) between steps.
30# [What] A trend-following, trailing-stop indicator.
31# [How] Uses an acceleration factor that increases as the trend persists to calculate a parabolic stop-and-reverse level, which flips position when the price crosses it.
32# [Who] J. Welles Wilder Jr.
33# -------------------------------------------------------------
34class ParabolicSAR:
35
36 # -------------------------------------------------------------
37 # Variable Definition: values
38 # [Role] The calculated Stop levels.
39 # -------------------------------------------------------------
40 # values = []
41​
42 # -------------------------------------------------------------
43 # Constructor: __init__
44 #
45 # [Why]
46 # Configure the acceleration limits.
47 #
48 # [Input]
49 # - acceleration_factor (default 0.02): Step size.
50 # - max_acceleration (default 0.2): Cap to prevent stop from hitting price too easily.
51 # -------------------------------------------------------------
52 def __init__(self, acceleration_factor=0.02, max_acceleration=0.2):
53 self.acceleration_factor = acceleration_factor
54 self.max_acceleration = max_acceleration
55 self.values = []
56​
57 # =============================================================================
58 # IPO: calculate
59 # =============================================================================
60 #
61 # [Input]
62 # - candles: List[dict]
63 #
64 # [Process]
65 # 1. Guess initial trend (first 2 bars).
66 # 2. Iterate bars.
67 # 3. Check for Trend Reversal (Price Crossing SAR).
68 # 4. If Trend Continues:
69 # a. Update Extreme Point (EP).
70 # b. Accelerate AF.
71 # c. Calculate Next SAR.
72 # d. Constrain SAR (Can't exceed previous Highs/Lows).
73 #
74 # [Output]
75 # - None (Populates 'values')
76 # =============================================================================
77 def calculate(self, candles):
78
79 # -------------------------------------------------------------
80 # Logic Step 1: Reset & Validation
81 # -------------------------------------------------------------
82 self.values.clear()
83
84 # Need at least 2 bars to determine slope start
85 if len(candles) < 2:
86 for _ in range(len(candles)):
87 self.values.append(None)
88 return
89​
90 # -------------------------------------------------------------
91 # Logic Step 2: Initial State (Heuristic)
92 #
93 # [Why]
94 # Wilder's original method requires previous data to start.
95 # Since we start at Bar 0, we must guess the trend direction.
96 # We compare Close[1] vs Close[0].
97 # -------------------------------------------------------------
98 is_uptrend = candles[1]['close'] > candles[0]['close']
99
100 # Initialize EP (Extreme Point) and SAR based on this guess
101 if is_uptrend:
102 sar = candles[0]['low'] # In Uptrend, SAR is below
103 ep = candles[0]['high'] # EP is the High
104 else:
105 sar = candles[0]['high'] # In Downtrend, SAR is above
106 ep = candles[0]['low'] # EP is the Low
107
108 af = self.acceleration_factor
109
110 # First SAR value is conceptual/initial, often invalid for trading
111 self.values.append(None)
112​
113 # -------------------------------------------------------------
114 # Logic Step 3: Main Loop (Forward Iteration)
115 #
116 # [Visual]
117 # PrevSAR=100. Trend=Up. EP=110. AF=0.02.
118 # NextSAR = 100 + 0.02 * (110 - 100) = 100.2
119 # Check if Price < 100.2 (Reversal?)
120 # -------------------------------------------------------------
121 for i in range(1, len(candles)):
122 c = candles[i]
123 prev_low = candles[i - 1]['low']
124 prev_high = candles[i - 1]['high']
125
126 # =============================================================
127 # State A: UPTREND Logic
128 # =============================================================
129 if is_uptrend:
130
131 # Logic Step 3.1: Check Trend Reversal
132 # Decision: Did price dip below the Stop Level (SAR)?
133 if c['low'] < sar:
134 # [Action] REVERSAL -> Switch to Downtrend
135 is_uptrend = False
136
137 # Store current SAR before resetting (some implementations do this differently,
138 # but here we record the level that was breached)
139 self.values.append(sar)
140
141 # Reset Logic for New Downtrend:
142 # 1. SAR becomes the old Extreme Point (Highest High)
143 sar = ep
144 # 2. EP becomes the new Low causing the reversal
145 ep = c['low']
146 # 3. AF resets to base
147 af = self.acceleration_factor
148
149 continue # Move to next bar with new state
150​
151 else:
152 # [Action] CONTINUATION -> Update Logic
153
154 # 1. Update Extreme Point
155 # If this bar is higher than best high so far, update EP and Accelerate.
156 if c['high'] > ep:
157 ep = c['high']
158 af = min(af + self.acceleration_factor, self.max_acceleration)
159
160 # 2. Store current SAR
161 self.values.append(sar)
162
163 # 3. Calculate Next SAR for tomorrow
164 # Formula: SAR_next = SAR_curr + AF * (EP - SAR_curr)
165 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar)
166
167 # 4. Constraint Rule (Wilder's Rule)
168 # SAR for an uptrend can NEVER be higher than the Low of the
169 # previous 2 bars. This prevents the stop from getting too close
170 # too fast due to a single spike.
171 sar = min(sar, prev_low)
172 if i > 1:
173 sar = min(sar, candles[i - 2]['low'])
174​
175 # =============================================================
176 # State B: DOWNTREND Logic
177 # =============================================================
178 else:
179
180 # Logic Step 3.1: Check Trend Reversal
181 # Decision: Did price pop above the Stop Level (SAR)?
182 if c['high'] > sar:
183 # [Action] REVERSAL -> Switch to Uptrend
184 is_uptrend = True
185
186 self.values.append(sar)
187
188 # Reset Logic for New Uptrend:
189 sar = ep # Old Lowest Low
190 ep = c['high'] # New High
191 af = self.acceleration_factor
192
193 continue
194​
195 else:
196 # [Action] CONTINUATION -> Update Logic
197
198 # 1. Update Extreme Point (Lowest Low)
199 if c['low'] < ep:
200 ep = c['low']
201 af = min(af + self.acceleration_factor, self.max_acceleration)
202
203 # 2. Store current SAR
204 self.values.append(sar)
205
206 # 3. Calculate Next SAR
207 # Note: Formula looks same, but (EP - SAR) is negative, so SAR moves down.
208 sar = sar + af * (ep - sar)
209
210 # 4. Constraint Rule
211 # SAR for downtrend cannot be lower than the High of previous 2 bars.
212 sar = max(sar, prev_high)
213 if i > 1:
214 sar = max(sar, candles[i - 2]['high'])
215​
216# =============================================================================
217# Static Wrapper Function
218# =============================================================================
219#
220# [Why] Functional API.
221# [Usage] sar_values = calculate(candles)
222# =============================================================================
223def calculate(candles, af=0.02, max_af=0.2):
224 instance = ParabolicSAR(af, max_af)
225 instance.calculate(candles)
226 return instance.values
